page.title: 15SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The Main concerns of the villagers are the threat of losing some of the telephone kiosks and the amount of nitrates used by farmers. There are only a few telephone kiosks in the area, but these are used by both young and old and are a vital life line for some of the more remote areas. The nitrate problem is very worrying because it affects all of us. The nitrate is put onto the land by the farmers, the rain then washes the nitrate out of the soil and into our streams and rivers and then into our drinking water, we have one of the highest levels of nitrates in our drinking water in the country and it is not advisable for babies under one year old to drink it. The wildlife is also at risk as they drink from the rivers and streams.
